N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 810.7 - Award criteria

State Regulations

Pursuant to the memorandum of agreement between the
department and the board, all applications shall be reviewed and evaluated by
the department and recommendations forwarded to the board. The evaluation of
the applications shall take into account, among other pertinent factors, the
following: (a) The program impact, including the seriousness of the safety and health hazards to which the project
will be directed and the number of persons who will benefit from the
project. (b) The program design, including the proven effectiveness of the methods to be utilized, the extent to
which the technical and scientific approaches to be utilized are accepted in
the health and safety professions, the qualifications and competency of the
project director and proposed staff, and the past experience of the training
group and/or the project sponsor in offering programs related to occupational
safety and health. (c) The lack of
duplication and the uniqueness of the project. (d) The administrative capability of the
grant recipient. (e) The extent to
which the grant applicant is currently receiving funds from grant programs and
other sources for safety and health programs. Notes
